newsitem.title: USA: Lowe's Companies post 71 percent jump in profits.
newsitem.headline: Lowe's Companies post 71 percent jump in profits.

text.p: Lowe's Companies Inc., a retailer of home improvement products, said Wednesday that its profits jumped 71 percent in the third quarter as it registered its best sales performance in two years.
The company, based in North Wilkesboro, N.C., said its net income for the three months ended Sept. 30 rose to $75.2 million, or 43 cents a share, from $43.9 million, or 27 cents a share.

It added that sales grew by 24 percent to $2.2 billion from $1.8 billion. The company said sales at stores of the same size opened more than a year rose 10 percent to $1.8 billion from $1.6 billion -- its best quarterly performance in two years.
It said it made significant sales gains in tools, heating and cooling devices, kitchen cabinets and appliances, home decor, yard, patio and garden furniture and home care and safety products.
The company also said that during the quarter it opened 12 new stores and relocated five others, ending the period with 391 stores, mostly in the South, Midwest and Southeast.
For the first nine months Lowe's said its net income climbed to $236.5 million, or $1.43 a share, from $187.9 million, or $1.17 a share, as sales rose 22 percent to $6.6 billion from $5.4 billion.
Sales at stores opened more than a year grew by 7 percent to $5.4 billion from $5.0 billion
Lowe's stock rose 12.5 cents to $38.125 on the New York Stock Exchange.
